reviewText: First Works gives you some great insight into some of Hollywood's most successful filmmakers. In rare, on-the-spot interviews we learn more abut the personal side of this very competitive industry. Susan Seidelman trying to bridge the gender gap; Ron Howard learning the craft from legendary B-movie director Roger Corman; John Carpenter and his slasher film "Halloween"; and Richard Donner discussing everything from his early years in television to the experience of directing "Superman". Included are their little-know student works, outtakes from blockbuster movies, celebrity remembrances, and much more.
